pros: Wonderful working environment to be in

job_title: Vice President Operations in New Haven, CT
pros: It is a good community with great values
cons: It is too small and not very progressive

job_title: Financial Aid Administrator in Southport, CT
pros: If you show initiative, they will invest in you and your training. It is a small office environment, so you get to know your coworkers very well -- all of the ladies are pretty great, and most are good cooks, which comes in handy for birthday celebrations or staff meetings. Also, you can get free tuition, which is pretty sweet.
cons: As with any Financial Aid Office, there were incredibly busy times where it was hard to keep up with the work. Also, you need to have a special kind of patience in order to educate students and parents about financing their college education - again though, that is not unique to this office, it is the nature of the field.

job_title: Adjunct Professor in New Haven, CT
pros: Department Chair is very supportive. Students are there because they want to be there, bringing a great diversity of interests and perspectives to class discussions.
cons: Rules are pretty firm. But that's a good thing as all students are treated with the same fairness and expectations.

review_title: Great place to work, doesn't pay well
job_title: Anonymous Employee in New Haven, CT
pros: Collegial work environment, focus on teaching & learning, inclusive culture, freedom to be creative within constraints
cons: Pay is below average for faculty, no tenure and limited other benefits to make up for low pay

job_title: PC Support Analyst in New Haven, CT
pros: Family oriented, great atmosphere, good benefits
